Obtain Necessary Tools



You should use the toolkit from NVidia (no matter what card you have). You can find it at here but I'll link you to the standard x86 since its the most commonly used. Do NOT use the following wget command unless you are on a regular 32 bit x86 processor (if you don't know what you have chances are its what you use). Please note that there are no cg libraries for PPC processors. If you are on a PPC processor it is safe to skip this step but you will possibly encounter a few graphics anomalies.

  • A word regarding superuser access: This guide uses the sudo command in a few places as the method for gaining root access. If your distro ships without sudo then you can su root and perform the sudo actions as root in that manner then exit back to normal user to continue with the rest of the guide. The superuser access is needed only to install the Nvidia Cg libraries and to create the installation directory with the right permissions.

# wget http://developer.download.nvidia.com/cg/Cg_2.0/2.0.0015/Cg-2.0_May2008_x86.tgz


Next copy the file to your root directory.

# sudo mv Cg-2.0_May2008_x86.tgz /


The next step is extracting it, then removing the old .gz file. Note change the filename if you are on a different architecture than x86

# cd /




# sudo tar -xf Cg-2.0_May2008_x86.tgz




# sudo rm Cg-2.0_May2008_x86.tgz



Getting source files



All the following commands are run as a normal user and Peragro Tempus will be built for that user only.

Choose a base directory for your installation. Peragro Tempus will be installed into a subdirectory peragro in the base directory and it can be your home directory. I prefer to install in /opt/peragro_svn and so the guide will reflect this. First create your directory using sudo, then give yourself permission to write there.

# sudo mkdir /opt/peragro_svn


Chamge ownership so that you can write in the directory and access it. Substitute "mysuername" with your real username. 

# sudo chown myusername:users /opt/peragro_svn



You should now change to your working directory.

# cd /opt/peragro_svn



Checking out sources from SVN repositories



Get the Peragro Tempus sources.

peragro_svn $ svn co https://cyanox.nl/peragro/trunk peragro



Download Cal3D library sources.

peragro_svn $ svn co -r 407 http://svn.gna.org/svn/cal3d/trunk cal3d



Download CrystalSpace sources.

peragro_svn $ svn co https://crystal.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/crystal/CS/trunk CS_latest



Download Crystal Entity Layer (CEL)

peragro_svn $ svn co https://cel.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/cel/cel/trunk CEL_latest



Download CeGui sources.

peragro_svn $ wget -c http://prdownloads.sourceforge.net/crayzedsgui/CEGUI-0.6.1.tar.gz?download



peragro_svn $ tar -xf CEGUI-0.6.1.tar.gz



peragro_svn $ rm CEGUI-0.6.1.tar.gz



Building Peragro Tempus



Create a profile file that sets all the necessary environment variables. We'll use a simple command to automatically create the file for you. Remember you should be in the directory you created, usually peragro_svn.

echo 'export CRYSTAL=$PWD/CS_latest
export CEL=$PWD/CEL_latest
export CSCONFPATH=$PWD/CEL_latest
export CAL3D=$PWD/cal3d/cal3d
export CEGUI=$PWD/CEGUI-0.6.1
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$PWD/cal3d/cal3d/src/cal3d/.libs/:$CEGUI/lib:$PWD/CS_latest/:$PWD/CEL_latest/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH'  > profile



Then load the profile. You have to reload the profile every time you exit the console and start another one.

peragro_svn $ source profile



Build the Cal3D library. 



peragro_svn $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d




peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ autoreconf --install --force




peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ ./configure --prefix=$CAL3D




peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ make




peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ make install



If the make command ends with an error then enter the following command 

Peragro Tempus $ sed -i 's/all_libraries = @all_libraries@/#all_libraries = @all_libraries@/' /opt/Peragro Tempus_svn/Peragro Tempus/cal3d/cal3d/src/cal3d/Makefile.am



Then rerun configure and make and make install.

Build CeGui 0.6.1



peragro_svn/cal3d/cal3d $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.6.1




peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.6.1 $ ./configure --prefix=$CEGUI --disable-xerces-c




peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.6.1 $ make




peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.6.1 $ make install



Build CrystalSpace. 



peragro_svn/CEGUI-0.6.1 $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CS_latest




peragro_svn/CS_latest $ ./configure --without-java --without-lib3ds --without-libaws --with-cal3d=$CAL3D --with-CEGUI=$CEGUI



Note: If you want to compile with optimizations for your specific processor, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things less stable.

--enable-cpu-specific-optimizations



Note: If you want to compile debug enabled, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things slower.

--enable-debug



peragro_svn/CS_latest $ jam -aq libs plugins cs-config cs-config-1.9 walktest



Build Crystal Entity Layer. 



peragro_svn/CS_latest $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/CEL_latest




peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ ./autogen.sh




peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ ./configure



Note: If you want to compile with optimizations for your specific processor, add the following tag to the configure command above. Be warned this may make things less stable.

--enable-cpu-specific-optimizations




peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ jam -aq libs plugins cel-config cel-config-1.9



Build Peragro Tempus. 



peragro_svn/CEL_latest $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/peragro




peragro_svn/peragro $ ./autogen.sh




peragro_svn/peragro $ ./configure --with-CEGUI=$CEGUI




peragro_svn/peragro $ jam -q



If everything went right you should now have a fully compiled client rearing and ready to go!

Running and testing with a local server.

In order to run the client simply make sure to load your profile variables in /opt/peragro_svn by running:

 $ source /opt/peragro_svn/profile



Then cd into the peragro directory like so: 

 $ cd /opt/peragro_svn/peragro



Then to run the client run: 

peragro_svn/peragro $ ./peragro



To test a local server you must launch one with:

peragro_svn/peragro $ ./peragro-server &



This will open the server in the background. Run ./peragro to launch the client then select localhost in the server list.

The End



If anyone has any suggestions for improving this guide or has noticed some mistakes, please email me at OldSpiceAP@gmail.com and I'll have a look.
